"requisition" is here used to mean "requisition for full government service."requisition for full government service." the tessels shown as "free from requisition " there! include the vessels that are requisitioned under the special liner requisitioning scheme, under which vessels, while running for government accc are run by their owners and accept some private cargo.tf includes 21 vessels (55,472 g.t.) transferred from norwegian flag under the norwegian agreement. as these require to he replacwj norwegian service bv british vessels they do not represent additional vessels available for british service. 1,600 GROSS TONNAGE AND OVER ON 1917.Lakes) as to render them not available for ocean-going trade or requisition.ii.analysis of vessels under notice of requisition, shown under ii. All liner trades are being requisitioned under special conditions, which, while leaving the ^ essels still under the management of their owners, and free to accept private as well as Government cargo, secure the profits to the Government, the owners being paid on a Blue Book basis. General requisitions have been served on the following lines, bat the individual vessels only come gradually under the requisition as they arrive in the United Kingdom, or other specified place of discharge.\ These were formerly included in a separate main heading VI., on page '2. Includes vessels carrying outward cargo to Gibraltar or Port Said, where homeward commitment is unknown.Aberdeen Line.Allan Line.Anchor Line.Asiatic S.N.
